document.docAuthor: Chang, Wan-Jin, Li, Fengyuan & Li, Shuqiang
document.docTitle: Qiongocera luoxuan Li & Li, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: On the genera Qiongocera and Relictocera (Araneae, Psilodercidae) from Southeast Asia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: On the genera Qiongocera and Relictocera (Araneae, Psilodercidae) from Southeast Asia

subSubSection.paragraph: Qiongocera luoxuan Li & Li sp. nov. Figs 1B, C, E, 4, 5, 12A, 13

Holotype: ♂ (IZCAS), China, Hainan Province, Dongfang City, Donghe Town, Yalong Village, Yalong-Huangxian Cave, 18°58.752'N , 108°53.308'E , 264 m, 15.XII.2014, Zhao Q. and Shao L. Paratypes: 1♂1♀ (IZCAS), same data as holotype.
The species name is a noun in apposition derived from the Chinese pinyin "luόxuan" (helical) and refers to the helical shape of the bulb in the distal half.
Known only from the type locality (Fig. 13).
